instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.SMC_TCK: What is SMC_TCK? SMC_TCK is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TMS: What is SMC_TMS? SMC_TMS is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: What is SMC_MANUAL_RST_L? SMC_MANUAL_RST_L resets the SMC when low.   _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.P3V42_G3H: What is P3V42_G3H? P3V42_G3H is a typo of PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_N: What is CHGR_CSI_N? CHGR_CSI_N is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_N and CHGR_CSI_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
Hello all,

   I need some help with this 2015 Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. The computer boots with the power cable but only with the battery disconnected. Swapped out three different battery's which  will work until the batteries die as they are not being charged. Removed from the system the board gets power and the fan turns on but no green or orange light. When powered on with the cable it last 15 minutes until it shutsdown and requires the wall outlet to be unplugged and the computer restarted.


PPBUS g3h 8.58-8.59

I tried to measure everything related to power and charging I could find with or without a battery connected to try and find and I found the voltage to the <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> drops when a battery is connected. While searching the forum a user had a similar issue and it ending up being related to "a bad trace of SYS Detect L" but there was no explaining of the fix.  Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Ooops, lot of time wasted with measurments.
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> looks good in your case (0V).

Battery can't be charged until get Magsafe light!
So that's the first thing to fix.
You must get amber light, even without battery.

Did you test with known good LIO board/flex?
As you didn't mention any audio related problem, <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> connection must be good.
I suspect a problem with <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> line.
Inspect J9500 pins for corrosion.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 93094, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Ooops, lot of time wasted with measurments.
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> looks good in your case (0V).

Battery can't be charged until get Magsafe light!
So that's the first thing to fix.
You must get amber light, even without battery.

Did you test with known good LIO board/flex?
As you didn't mention any audio related problem, <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> connection must be good.
I suspect a problem with <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> line.
Inspect J9500 pins for corrosion.
[/QUOTE]

Thanks you for the advice I don’t see any corrosion on the J9500 ..

I replaced the LIO and cable with no success but it was a used item seller said it worked but who knows.

With the board plugged in I measured on the LIO board pin 3 adapter sense if on j6910 and it’s 0…

<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>
Pin 4 sys one wire : 0
Pin 5 adapter sense uf in R: 0
Pin 1 smc bc sock cc: 0

<RESISTOR>R6900</RESISTOR>
Sysone andsmc bc acok vcc both 0

<CHIP>U6901</CHIP>

pin 1 and 2 Smc bc acok both 3.33
Pin 4 smc bc acok vcc: p
Pin 5 pp3v42 G3h :0 
Thank you again

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
"Pin 5 pp3v42 G3h :0"
As expected, <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage doesn't arrive to LIO board.
So you have bad LIO flex, or connectors.
I fixed such a problem few times bypassing with tiny wire directly from L7095/<CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR>.

BTW, write directly into reply box, instead of clicking Reply button.
I don't see any reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Please, maintain forum esthetic.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message: Sorry about copying the previous reply…I ending buying a new LIO board and cable and still no light or no <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> on the LIO board which connections would I need to connect to bridge the issue and is there any measurement I can make to confirm what component is at fault…. Thanks again

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message: You have to run a wire from <CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR> to <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> (pin 5).

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
Thank you I ran the wire and have green to yellow light but no battery detection. OS Monterey boots with power plugged in and battery connected but there is no battery icon. When check the battery capacity in terminal it shows 0. I downgraded to High sierra and still have the same issue. When I pull  the power the computer shuts off. Measurements with the machine power on and plugged in show a low PPBUS G3H. I ordered another battery but with the low PPBUS I am worried I may have shorted something when diagnosing or fixing the sysone line. The machine functions although it does feel a little laggy.

[TD][RIGHT]8.2[/RIGHT][/TD]

[TD]0.02[/TD]

[TD]0.23[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]


Edit : Was measuring the Test Point for <SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL> for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> which measured 19v the light on the charged shut off and fan went off. PPBUS G3H is now 0V PP3v42 is still 3.38. The board will not power on at all now.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message: What is actual diode mode to ground reading on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message: I put the black lead on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and the red lead to ground and get .129

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
So no shorte tere.
Post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
Missing ACIN, fix that problem.
Check diode mode there first.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
Diode Mode ACIN 0.000

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> is reading 17.09v on pin 1 <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> and pin 2 <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> is 0  and its resistance reading  90k ohm

<RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> resistance reading 1 ohm

<RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> resistance is reading 1k ohm

do i need to swap out <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
NO.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> and check again.
If still the same, replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message: Removed <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> tested diode mode on acin 008

threads.title: Macbook Air 11" 2015 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charging light. Boots up with battery removed.
threads.message:
Then change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Just in case, check again diode mode, before applying power.
